skillTree.localised_description: The Dukes of Bretonnia will command their hosts of Knights from the backs of mighty barded steeds.

skillTree.localised_description: The purest of all pegasi, legend has it that they descend from Glorfinial, the mighty steed of a Grail Companion.

skillTree.localised_description: Taming a mighty hippogryph presents a challenge that many Bretonnian lords cannot turn down.

skillTree.localised_description: A Knightly formation, in the Lady's name, to smash through battle lines; to defeat evil in the field.
Thorough drilling increases the peasants' chances of withstanding the horrors of battle.
Like the lion, this one is the biggest and the bravest of his kind... with the sharpest teeth.
From the verdant depths, the Lady rises to protect the faithful.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "He seemed like an immortal, divine paladin, a faultless living legend, and strength, majesty and faith radiated from him like the heat from an inferno."

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +4 for Grail Knights and Grail Guardians units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +8 for Grail Knights and Grail Guardians
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: +10% for Grail Knights and Grail Guardians
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Although a fierce foe to Bretonnia's enemies, Knights should be wary of their kleptomaniac tendencies…"

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Bohemond's vast estates are almost entirely rural. His castle of Bastonne is located on a high, craggy rock overlooking the Forest of Châlons. From here Bohemond and his mighty retinue of knights wage constant war against the Orcs, Skaven and other vile creatures infesting the mountainous wilderness in the heart of Bretonnia.

effects.description:
Attribute: Immune to Psychology when in own or allied territory
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +8 when in own or allied territory
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Bastonnians like to think of themselves as the heart of Bretonnia. They are the people of Gilles the Unifier, and the dukedom is roughly in the physical centre of the nation. They have more pride in their nation than do the people of any other dukedom, and the worship of the Lady of the Lake is popular with peasants as well as nobles.

effects.description: Construction time: -2 for Bretonnian Stable and Pasture buildings
Construction cost: -30% for Bretonnian Stable and Pasture buildings

skillTree.localised_description: Bohemond's search for the Holy Grail was known to have ended in a vicious duel with a massive Dragon. Casting his opponent down, Bohemond then forged a fearsome mace from the Dragon's immense thigh bone.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even stupid peasants can learn to stand fast and brace against the charge.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
As an expert in such matters, it is their duty to know the king's law and to mete justice in his name.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
The Lord is entitled to collect tithes from tenants in return for continued protection.
They've seen the Lady's acts or witnessed her blessed grace.
Dukes are the highest rank within Bretonnian society, second only to the Royarch himself.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +2 for Paladins
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: "The land from here to the sea is yours, if you enforce the king's will."
The knowledge that they fight in the king's name, with his support, steels an army for the privations of the siege.
This being must be touched by Tzeentch, seeing things before they happen.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +8%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: Lords must not be concerned with the collecting of taxes; there are others whose lot it is to feel the people's scorn.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

ui_effects.localised_text: Greatly replenishes hit points of combatants

factionEffects.localised_description: Duke Bohemond has left the safety of Castle Bastonne and traveled to Mount Silverspear, where he must battle the greenskin menace and other unholy filth living in the darklands.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +6 for Lords and embedded Heroes
	(all armies)

Melee defence: +6 for Lords and embedded Heroes
	(all armies)

items.colour_text: When Bohemond reached the end of his quest the Lady of the Lake bade him wash the dragon's blood off his shield. The waters of the sacred lake cleansed the shield and imbued it with magical power.

Bohemond’s huge mace is an awesome weapon, as weighty with magic as it is heavy with iron. Its shaft is carved from the thigh bone of a Dragon slain by Bohemond, and its bulbous bead was wrought from meteoric iron by Dwarf Runesmiths.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Bohemond Beastslayer is the Duke of the vast domain of Bastonne in the heartland of Bretonnia. One of the god-like Grail Knights, he is renowned for slaying the mightiest beasts and the most horrific monstrosities.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -30% for Grail Knights and Grail Guardians
	(Lord's army)
Passive ability: "The Blessing of the Lady"

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The Beastslayer possesses a lance forged into the shape of a snarling dragon, he often takes it to battlefield instead of his Beast Mace.
